page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY BUILDINGS
page.content: { BRADSHAW HALL. The ruins of Bradshaw Hall can be seen at the bottom of Hawkhill Road, opposite the car park. This building was never completed or lived in as the Hall was being completed just as the plague broke out.The Bradshaw family who were squires of Eyam fled from the village to avoid the plague. {EYAM HALL.} This Tudor building has been the home of the Wright family for three hundred years. It was built after the plague using some material from the ruins of Bradshaw Hall. Eyam Hall is to be found opposite the stocks in the centre of the village {ST. LAWRENCE'S CHURCH. Situated near to Eyam Hall,the parish church has sections from many periods of history. Part is still the original
